definition: (botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion, put firmly in the mind
details:
noun
- (botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
= synonyms: flora, plant life
- buildings for carrying on industrial labor
= example: buildings for carrying on industrial labor
= synonyms: works, industrial plant
- something planted secretly for discovery by another
= example: something planted secretly for discovery by another
- an actor situated in the audience whose acting is rehearsed but seems spontaneous to the audience
verb
- put firmly in the mind
= synonyms: implant
- place something or someone in a certain position in order to secretly observe or deceive
- fix or set securely or deeply
= example: fix or set securely or deeply
= synonyms: implant, embed, engraft, imbed
- put or set (seeds, seedlings, or plants) into the ground
= example: put or set (seeds, seedlings, or plants) into the ground
= synonyms: set
- set up or lay the groundwork for
= synonyms: found, institute, establish, constitute
- place into a river
= example: place into a river
